title: Your Weekend Sports Round-Up: Football, Cricket, and Formula 1
byline: Sri Lankan sports fans have plenty to look forward to this weekend. Whether it’s Premier League football, top-level cricket, or the thrill of Formula 1 in Brazil, there’s a full line-up of matches and moments waiting to be enjoyed.

title: DNA pioneer James Watson dies at 97
byline: Nobel Prize-winning American scientist James Watson, one of the co-discoverers of the structure of DNA, has died aged 97.

title: Security plan for Pakistan, Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe cricket series 2025 finalized
byline: The Punjab Home Department has completed the security arrangements for the upcoming three-nation cricket series 2025 between Pakistan, Sri Lanka, and Zimbabwe.

title: It is an IMF-dictated budget: Opposition Leader
byline: The 2026 budget is a clearly IMF-dictated budget, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said yesterday.

title: Minister to seek Defense Ministry clarification on helicopter repair tender
byline: Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said he would discuss the helicopter repair tender with the Ministry of Defense and provide a detailed response next week.

title: Shooting in Kotahena linked to underworld rivalry
byline: Police suspect that underworld rivalry was the motive behind a fatal shooting reported in the 16th Lane area of Kotahena, in which a 43-year-old man was killed last night.

title: Thousands of US flights cancelled or delayed over government shutdown cuts
byline: More than 5,000 US flights were cancelled or delayed on Friday, in the first day of new mandates forcing airlines to reduce air traffic during the government shutdown.

title: Gampola Divisional Secretary ordered to pay Rs.100,000 to Ambuluwawa cable car project company
byline: Gampola Udapalatha Divisional Secretary Athma Dilrukshi Jayaratne was ordered yesterday by the Appeal Court to pay compensation of Rs. 100,000 to the construction company in charge of the Ambuluwawa cable car project, for obstructing the project through undue interference in her official capacity.

title: Speaker gets mixed up, causes confusion
byline: All MPs and others in the gallery were in confusion for a few minutes when Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne gave the microphone over to Chief Government Whip Nalinda Jayatissa to open the second reading of the debate on the budget, breaking the tradition of giving the opportunity to the Opposition to kick it off.

title: Millions of dollars provided by ADB for renovation of drainage, solid waste disposal gone missing
byline: More than USD 50 million provided by the Asian Development Bank (ADB) for drainage and solid waste disposal have gone missing since 2010, Minister of Public Administration and Provincial Councils A.H.M.H. Abeyratana told Parliament yesterday.

title: DNA pioneer James Watson dies at 97
byline: Nobel Prize-winning American scientist James Watson, one of the co-discoverers of the structure of DNA, has died aged 97.

title: Budget 2026 bets big on building back investor base
byline: In a signal to the investors weary of Sri Lanka’s uneven playing field, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake yesterday used Budget 2026 to draw a line under what he called an era of “cronyism, racketeering and nepotism”.

title: World’s biggest spider’s web discovered in cave
byline: Scientists have discovered 100,000 spiders living in what could be the biggest spider’s web in the world.

title: Indo-Lanka FTA - bilateral trade grown, but Sri Lanka lags behind: Ravi K
byline: The Indo-Lanka bilateral trade volume has grown exponentially, but Sri Lanka appears to be a loser with a trade gap heavily in favour of India, Parliament was informed today.

title: Indian authorities on high alert as Dawood Syndicate, LTTE join hands in South India drug trade
byline: Indian intelligence agencies have issued a serious alert over a new alliance forming between the Dawood Ibrahim syndicate and remnants of the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE). Officials say the D-syndicate is now exploiting South Indian and Sri Lankan routes to expand its drug trade after suffering major losses in western and northern India.

title: Turkey issues ‘genocide’ arrest warrants against Netanyahu and other Israeli officials
byline: Turkey on Friday issued arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and dozens of other Israeli officials on “genocide” charges.

title: Govt’s anti- corruption drive ok, politicization is problematic- Harsha de Silva
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Dr.Harsha de Silva, who opened the budget debate, said that he supports the government’s anti-corruption drive,  but it should not be driven with political interests.

title: UPS and FedEx ground some cargo planes after Kentucky air disaster
byline: American delivery firms UPS and FedEx have temporarily grounded part of their fleets of cargo planes after a mid-take-off crash in Kentucky on Tuesday left at least 14 people dead.

title: Met Department warns of severe lightning in several areas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an advisory warning of thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning in several parts of the country, including the North-western, Uva, Central, and Sabaragamuwa provinces, as well as the Anuradhapura, Mannar, Ampara, and Hambantota districts.

title: Central Bank revises vehicle leasing limits
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka has revised the maximum loan-to-value (LTV) ratios applicable for vehicle leasing facilities. According to the new guidelines, the maximum leasing percentage for commercial vehicles has been set at 70%, while the maximum for private vehicles has been limited to 50%.
